net.java.dev.designgridlayout
Interface IBarRow

public interface IBarRow

Any row created by DesignGridLayout.row().bar() implements this interface. Through this interface, you can add components to the current row.

All added components share the same width (the maximum of all components preferred widths) and can be aligned on the left, center or right depending on which method is called to add them, or the Tag they are assigned when added.

The actual position of added components depends on the current platform; standard buttons (as determined by their assigned Tag) will always follow the guidelines for the current platform.

Author:
Jean-Francois Poilpret

Method Summary

          Adds a tagged component to this row.
 IBarRow center(javax.swing.JComponent... children)
          Adds components to the center of this row.

          Adds components to the left of this row.

          Adds components to the right of this row.
 IBarRow withOwnRowWidth()
          Makes this row independent of other non-grid rows in terms of component width.
 

Method Detail

left

IBarRow left(javax.swing.JComponent... children)
Adds components to the left of this row. Components are added left to right, in the same order as they appear in the arguments list.

This method is equivalent to: 

 for (JComponent child: children)
 {
     add(child, Tag.LEFT);
 }

Parameters:
children - components to add to the left of this row
Returns:
this row (to allow chaining other methods for the current row)

center

IBarRow center(javax.swing.JComponent... children)
Adds components to the center of this row. Components are added left to right, in the same order as they appear in the arguments list.

This method is equivalent to: 

 for (JComponent child: children)
 {
     add(child, Tag.OTHER);
 }

Parameters:
children - components to add to the center of this row
Returns:
this row (to allow chaining other methods for the current row)

right

IBarRow right(javax.swing.JComponent... children)
Adds components to the right of this row. Components are added left to right, in the same order as they appear in the arguments list.

This method is equivalent to: 

 for (JComponent child: children)
 {
     add(child, Tag.RIGHT);
 }

Parameters:
children - components to add to the right of this row
Returns:
this row (to allow chaining other methods for the current row)

add

IBarRow add(javax.swing.JComponent child,
            Tag tag)
Adds a tagged component to this row. The component is placed in the row at a location determined by guidelines for the current platform, based on its Tag.

Parameters:
child - the component to add to this row
tag - the tag to assign to child that will determine the actual position of child in the row
Returns:
this row (to allow chaining other methods for the current row)

gap

IBarRow gap()
Adds a larger gap (see LayoutStyle.ComponentPlacement.UNRELATED) after the component that has been added just before this method is called. Has no effect if no component was added before. Multiple consecutive calls have the same effect as only one call, DesignGridLayout will never accumulate consecutive gaps.

Returns:
this row (to allow chaining other methods for the current row)

withOwnRowWidth

IBarRow withOwnRowWidth()
Makes this row independent of other non-grid rows in terms of component width. By default, DesignGridLayout ensures that all non-grid rows in a layout use the same width for all components of all these rows. In general, this is the behavior expected by end-users; however, there may be some situations where this behavior is not desirable.

Note that you can disable DesignGridLayout feature of consistent widths across non-grid rows with DesignGridLayout.withoutConsistentWidthAcrossNonGridRows().

Returns:
this row (to allow chaining other methods for the current row)
